series.title: Ronna & Beverly
series.author: Earwolf and Jessica Chaffin, Jamie Denbo

episodes.title: Episode 153: The 2017 OSCAR Podcast
episodes.summary: It's that time of the year again, and Oscar experts Adam B. Vary, Kate Aurthur, and Jarett “The Wiesel” Wieselman of BuzzFeed join Ronna & Beverly to talk all things Academy Awards! From Manchester by the Sea to Mahershala Ali, who will win out big time? Which actors and actresses will take home the gold for their performance? Tune in to hear from the best! This episode is sponsored by Squarespace ( www.squarespace.com  code: SHALOM) and Keepsake ( www.keepsake.us/shalom ).

episodes.title: Episode 152: Live from the SF Sketchfest w/ James Urbaniak, Arden Myrin
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly pay a visit to San Francisco for the annual SF Sketchfest! They welcome very talented actors James Urbaniak (Difficult People) and Arden Myrin (Shameless) to chat about drag queen leisure wear, the whole refugee project, on-stage engagements, old-timey podcasts, Ambien Santa, and much, much more. This episode is sponsored by ThirdLove (www.thirdlove.com/shalom) and Keepsake (www.keepsake.us/shalom).

episodes.title: Episode 151: Ana Ortiz
episodes.summary: Actress Ana Ortiz joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about acts of kindness at the Women's March, keeping your cool, and much more. Plus, the girls share a clip from their appearance at the Planned Parenthood benefit. This episode is sponsored by Squarespace ( www.squarespace.com  code: SHALOM) and Keepsake ( www.keepsake.us/shalom ).

episodes.title: Episode 150: Pam Fryman
episodes.summary: The very talented director Pam Fryman joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about being an intern for The Mike Douglas Show in high school, her love of working How I Met Your Mother, meeting her husband while working on Hollywood Squares, and much more. Plus, the ladies tell us about their trip to St. Barths and read some of the beautiful cards they’ve received from their lovely listeners.Please help out Penelope’s “Where Are The Women” cause by purchasing some Girl Scout Cookies by visiting:  https://digitalcookie.girlscouts.org/scout/penelope687715  (link goes live Jan. 3)This episode is brought to you by Third Love ( www.thirdlove.com/shalom  and Squarespace ( www.squarespace.com  code: SHALOM).

episodes.title: Episode 149: D'Arcy Carden
episodes.summary: The lovely, pleasant, and hilarious D'Arcy Carden (The Good Place) joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about the origin of her name, her siblings, ice-cream, and much more. Plus, the ladies tell us how they celebrated their Christmas. Happy New Year!Please help out Penelope’s “Where Are The Women” cause by purchasing some Girl Scout Cookies by visiting:  https://digitalcookie.girlscouts.org/scout/penelope687715  (link goes live Jan. 3)This episode is brought to you by Third Love ( www.thirdlove.com/shalom  and Squarespace ( www.squarespace.com  code: SHALOM).

episodes.title: Episode 148: Charles Rogers
episodes.summary: Writer/director/actor Charles Rogers joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about the ins and outs of his show Search Party on TBS, having hippie parents, his first movie Fort Tilden, and much more. Happy Holidays!This episode is brought to you by Third Love ( www.thirdlove.com/shalom )

episodes.title: Episode 147: Live from Boston Jewish Film Festival w/ Eugene Mirman
episodes.summary: Recorded live as part of The Boston Jewish Film Festival at the Somerville Theatre in Boston, the fabulous Eugene Mirman of Bob’s Burgers joins Ronna and Beverly to chat about growing up speaking only Russian, crying for 45 minutes as part of his 9 volume comedy album, and who he closely resembles. It’s a fantastic night shared here for your listening pleasure!This episode is brought to you by Third Love ( www.thirdlove.com/shalom ) and Harry’s ( www.Harrys.com  code: SHALOM).

episodes.title: Episode 146: Jordan Black
episodes.summary: The adorable actor/improviser Jordan Black joins Ronna and Beverly to chat about working with Joey McIntyre of New Kids on The Block, his live show “The Black Version,” the Jamie Foxx commercial campaign he’s in, and much more. Plus, Beverly surprises Ronna with some Broadway news.This episode is brought to you by Third Love, Squarespace, and Harry’s.

episodes.title: Bonus Episode
episodes.summary: Election Bonus Episode with Matt McConkey. Made with love.

episodes.title: Episode 145: Live at Now Hear This with Jimmy Pardo
episodes.summary: Ronna and Beverly come to you live from the Now Hear This Podcast Festival with Never Not Funny's Jimmy Pardo! They'll chat about what makes a good late night talk show host, baseball players, and amusement parks. Plus, we hear what happened to get Beverly Disneyland banned.This episode is brought to you by Squarespace and Third Love.

episodes.title: Episode 144: Matt Cook
episodes.summary: Actor and comedian Matt Cook (Man with a Plan) joins Ronna and Beverly to chat about their shared love of English chocolates, practicing his Boston accent for TBS’ Clipped, and his love of video games. Plus, Beverly tells us about a previous interaction she had with Trump.This episode is brought to you by Squarespace and Third Love.

episodes.title: Episode 143: Leslie Grossman, Adam O'Byrne
episodes.summary: Leslie Grossman and Adam O’Byrne join Ronna and Beverly this week to dig into the Amanda Knox documentary. Plus, Spaghetti-O’s made a friend in the park!This episode is brought to you by Squarespace and Third Love.

episodes.title: Episode 142: Stay Healthy with Our Advice
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly are back in the Earwolf studio in Los Angeles to go through listener comments as well as offer advice on staying fit & healthy, making new friends, where is a good place to raise the child of a Thai prostitute, and more.This episode is brought to you by Squarespace and Third Love.

episodes.title: Episode 141: Ben Platt
episodes.summary: Broadway star Ben Platt chats with Ronna and Beverly about the inception of Dear Evan Hansen, a new musical on Broadway of which he is the star, what his New York looks like, and why you don't have to be a tortured soul to be an artist. Plus, Beverly tells us how she bailed out Spaghetti-O's at school after a skirmish.This episode is sponsored by Squarespace and Third Love.

episodes.title: Episode 140: Rachel Bloom
episodes.summary: Crazy Ex-Girlfriend's Rachel Bloom joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about some of her favorite musicals she did in high school, falling in love with sketch comedy writing in college, recently getting coffee with a childhood bully, and working on the second season of Crazy Ex-Girlfriend. Plus, Ronna and Beverly weigh in on French police making a woman remove clothing on a beach following a burkini ban.This episode is sponsored by Third Love and Smile Direct Club.

episodes.title: Episode 139: Jessi Klein
episodes.summary: The absolutely wonderful Jessi Klein (Inside Amy Schumer head writer/executive producer) joins Ronna and Beverly to chat about motherhood, getting lost in Central Park, her new book of hilarious essays "You'll Grow Out of It," and shaking Gwyneth Paltrow's hand. Plus, Spaghetti-O's tells us what was her favorite thing she did in the city of Boston.This episode is sponsored by Squarespace and Third Love.

episodes.title: Episode 138: Cynthia D'Aprix Sweeney
episodes.summary: New York Times bestselling author Cynthia D'Aprix Sweeney joins Ronna and Beverly to chat about her fabulous novel The Nest, teaching her children about safe sex, and seeing Oprah out in public. Plus, Beverly loves summer again and Ronna tells us about her big adventure to the vineyard.This episode is sponsored by Third Love.

episodes.title: Episode 137: Live from The Bell House NYC w/ Ellie Kemper, Wyatt Cenac
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly visited the Big Apple and had a fantastic time! Listen as they welcome comedians Ellie Kemper (Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt) and Wyatt Cenac (People of Earth) for a grand ol' time recorded live from The Bell House in Brooklyn! What more can you ask for?This episode is sponsored by "Once A Soldier" by Mary Jo Putney and Third Love.

episodes.title: Episode 136: Kristian Bruun
episodes.summary: The handsome Kristian Bruun of Orphan Black joins Ronna and Beverly to chat about working alongside the many clones of Tatiana Maslany, getting struck by lightning while he was on dinghy, and what's going on with his love life. Plus, the ladies share their thoughts on Brexit. Happy 4th of July!This episode is sponsored by All In by Simona Ahrnstedt, Squarespace, and Third Love.

episodes.title: Episode 135: Tami Sagher
episodes.summary: Comedy powerhouse Tami Sagher (Don't Think Twice, 30 Rock) chats with Ronna & Beverly about being born in Israel, leaving in a reminder line in a script she wrote for the TV show Psych, what it's like to spend the day with Tina Fey on her time writing for 30 Rock, and starring as one of the members of the improv troupe in Mike Birbiglia's film Don't Think Twice. Plus, Ronna and Beverly extend their love to the LGBTQ community.This episode is sponsored by Third Love and Harry's.

episodes.title: Episode 134: Troy Walker
episodes.summary: Dapper stand-up comedian Troy Walker joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about being a lawyer in the state of Colorado, the Casa Bonita experience, and his plans to rule Hollywood. Plus, Beverly tells us about her recent trip to New York in which she saw Waitress: The Musical.

episodes.title: Episode 133: Ally Maki
episodes.summary: The absolutely adorable Ally Maki joins Ronna and Beverly to chat about her role in the new TBS comedy Wrecked, playing a man on Bones, growing up in Seattle, and her favorite theatre roles she has portrayed. Plus, the ladies share how they spent Mother's Day.

episodes.title: Episode 132: Beanie Feldstein
episodes.summary: The fabulous Beanie Feldstein joins Ronna and Beverly to chat about her role in Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising, her love of musical theater, and the origin of her nickname Beanie. Plus, the ladies talk all about Beyoncé's Lemonade with Howl Production Manager Tiffany.

episodes.title: Episode 131: Advice You Need
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly return to the Earwolf studio in Los Angeles to go through listener comments as well as offer advice on feeling guilty for moving far away from your family to follow your dreams, telling your friend that they are dating a jerk, mother/daughter relationships, and more!

episodes.title: Episode 130: Paul W. Downs
episodes.summary: Ronna and Beverly are joined by the accomplished, young, and adorable Paul W. Downs to chat about Broad City, writing with his life partner Lucia Aniello, his episode of Netflix's The Characters, and playing Ilana Glazer's identical cousin in a Comedy Central 4/20 special entitled "Time Traveling Bong."

episodes.title: Episode 129: Live at UCB Sunset with Kulap Vilaysack, Michael Constantini
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly return to the beautiful UCB-Sunset in Los Angeles and this time they are joined by Who Charted's Kulap Vilaysack and Engineer Sam! They'll talk about her new comedy series Bajillion Dollar Propertie$ on Seeso, the status of her Origin Story documentary, and help out listeners with some expert advice. Plus, Michael Constantini makes a very rare appearance!

episodes.title: Episode 128: Kevin Kirkpatrick
episodes.summary: Ronna and Beverly are joined by international Groundling Kevin Kirkpatrick to talk about growing up in a food panic, being treated horribly by his grandmother, and not enjoying his partying on Ambien experience. Plus, Beverly tells us all about her trip to Argentina.

episodes.title: Episode 127: The 2016 OSCAR Podcast
episodes.summary: Oscar experts Adam B. Vary, Kate Aurthur, and Jarett "The Wiesel" Wieselman of BuzzFeed join Ronna & Beverly to talk all things Oscars! From Room to The Revenant, who will win for best picture? Which actors and actresses will take home the gold for their performance? Tune in to hear from the best!

episodes.title: Episode 126: LIVE at UCB w/ Ben Feldman, Reid Scott
episodes.summary: Ronna and Beverly come to you live from the UCB theatre in Los Angeles with their special guests and handsome fellows Ben Feldman of Superstore and Reid Scott of Veep. They'll discuss the alternate career path Reid's mother wanted him to pursue, Reid playing a schmuck on Veep, Ben's character on Superstore, how to get in contact with Woody Allen, and the one time Beverly ran into Bernie Sanders.Photos by  mixedvegetables

episodes.title: Episode 125: Live at the San Francisco Sketch Fest 2016
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly had a magnificent time at this year's San Francisco Sketch Fest and are now sharing it with you! Joining them is the wonderfully warm & hilarious Guy Branum and the cute as a button Kate Micucci of Garfunkel and Oates. What more can you ask for?

episodes.title: Episode 124: Advice for 2016!
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly are back in Los Angeles at the Earwolf studio with Engineer Sam to go through listener comments as well as offer advice on dealing with cat fat shaming, which restaurants to visit in LA, raising kids, and more!

episodes.title: Episode 123: Zoe Bell
episodes.summary: Happy N(j)ew Year from Ronna & Beverly! The kick ass Zoe Bell joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about her first break as a stuntwoman on Xena: Warrior Princess, her transition from stunt work on Kill Bill to becoming an actress with a major role in Quentin Tarantino's Death Proof, her role in The Hateful Eight, and why the praying mantis is the only thing that frightens her.

episodes.title: Episode 122: Gearoid Farrelly
episodes.summary: Happy Holidays and Happy New Year from Ronna & Beverly! Irish comedian Gearoid Farrelly joins them this week to chat about owning a rabbit, being frightened by driving on the different side of the road in Los Angeles, being in a gay relationship with a scientist, and the time he celebrated his birthday with Joan Rivers. Plus, Beverly shares why she's not in the Christmas spirit this year.

episodes.title: Episode 121: Joel Stein
episodes.summary: Joel Stein, journalist extraordinaire and regular contributor to Time joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about his experience getting hair plugs, getting a call from GQ for him to get in superhero shape, The Naughty Jewish Boys Calendar, and trying to improve his marriage by watching less porn which can be heard on his new HOWL podcast What's Wrong With Me? Also, Beverly apologizes for an incident that occurred this past Thanksgiving.Check out Joel's GQ piece here:  http://www.gq.com/story/fitness-how-to-get-chris-pratt-fit

episodes.title: Episode 120: Jessica St. Clair
episodes.summary: Ronna and Beverly welcome Jessica St. Clair of Playing House. Jessica talks about how to master discount shopping, the specifics of female hygiene, and which actors have less than adequate dongs. Also, Ronna and Bev talk about the tragedy in Paris, as well as the dangers of misplaced anger.

episodes.title: Episode 119: Live at UCB w/ Ravi Patel, Jack McGee
episodes.summary: Ronna and Beverly come to you live from the UCB theatre in Los Angeles with their guests Jack McGee and Ravi Patel, both of FOX’s Grandfathered. Together they’ll discuss Jack’s career as a fireman turned character actor, how Ravi’s personal life has influenced his film making, and all things pertaining to the pope.

episodes.title: Episode 118: Phil Rosenthal
episodes.summary: This week, Phil Rosenthal, creator and executive producer of "Everybody Loves Raymond," joins Ronna & Beverly. Phil talks about his new food show "I'll Have What Phil's Having," how he manages to stay fit while taping, why Los Angeles is the greatest food city in America, and why a dead hooker is not always the sign of bad food. Also, Beverly takes issue with a snub that she received from a local magazine.

episodes.title: Episode 117: Advice For Your Life
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly are back in Los Angeles at the Earwolf studio to go through listener comments as well as offer advice on becoming roommates with a close friend, being worried about ruining a friendship by getting into a relationship, taking time to travel the world, and more!

episodes.title: Episode 116: Live At UCB w/ Danny Pudi, Paul F. Tompkins
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly return to the UCB theater in Los Angeles with their special guests Danny Pudi of Community and Paul F. Tompkins of Spontaneanation! Tune in to hear about the Polish plays Danny starred in as a child, Paul’s thoughts on Donald Trump, and what the ladies did for Yom Kippur this year.

episodes.title: Episode 115: Katie Lowes
episodes.summary: The gorgeous Katie Lowes of Scandal joins Ronna & Beverly this week in the Earwolf studios to chat about how she talked herself into getting on the Serial train, the truth behind the glasses she occasionally wears, the first time she meet her husband Adam Shapiro, and the joy of playing a hedgehog in Disney’s Zootopia. Plus, Beverly explains the best way to go about tidying away your problems.

episodes.title: Episode 114: Ellie Kemper
episodes.summary: Ellie Kemper is the definition of young at heart! Ellie joins Ronna & Bevery in the Earwolf studio to chat about the wonderful cast of Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt, why she hasn’t joined Twitter, meeting her husband when she did bits on Late Night with Conan O’Brien, and what her celebrity cause would be if she had one. Plus, Beverly explains why she’s been leaving a muffin on Ronna’s doorstep for the past 2 weeks.

episodes.title: Episode 113: Diablo Cody
episodes.summary: A wonderfully pink haired Diablo Cody joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about her mother-in-law being the inspiration behind her new film Ricki and the Flash, getting Meryl Streep to play the lead in the movie, who she thinks her Gayle might be, and working on Tig Notaro’s Amazon pilot. Also, Beverly has SpaghettiOs ask Ronna permission to use her pool for her upcoming birthday party.

episodes.title: Episode 112: Echo Kellum
episodes.summary: The handsome and hilarious Echo Kellum joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about being a professional child actor in Chicago, his children, Wyatt Cenac’s experience working with Jon Stewart on the Daily Show, and his upcoming role as superhero Mr. Terrific on CW’s Arrow. Plus, the ladies figure out who is vandalizing Ronna’s tomatoes.

episodes.title: Episode 111: More Advice For You!
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly are back in Los Angeles with a very special guest by the name of Nola to go through listener comments as well as offer advice on how to tell a friend they smell  like a dead fish, marriage, and more!

episodes.title: Episode 110: Mitch Silpa
episodes.summary: Happy 4th of July from Ronna & Beverly! The hilarious and wonderful Mitch Silpa of The Groundlings joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about the first time he met Ronna in Hungary, 27 Dresses being the most re-watchable movie, his experience auditioning for SNL, and much more. Plus, we hear what the ladies have planned for Independence Day.

episodes.title: Episode 109: Louis Peitzman
episodes.summary: The adorable Louis Peitzman of BuzzFeed joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about his generation always being in front of a screen, his live storytelling show “Cheaper Than Therapy” which he co-hosts with Sarah Thyre, Caitlyn Jenner, the creator of The Human Centipede, and how we easily forget how racist Disney movies were. Plus, the ladies follow up with one of their listeners and offer them some marriage advice.

episodes.title: Episode 108: Live At UCB with Jeff Garlin and Matt Walsh
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly once again bring down the house at the UCB theater in Los Angeles with their special guests Matt Walsh of HBO’s Veep and Jeff Garlin of The Goldbergs! Tune in to hear behind the scenes stories of Hugh Laurie, the legend of the super sized Snickers bar, and how Jeff lost his virginity to a heckler.

episodes.title: Episode 107: Advice For All!
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly are back to help out their listeners with advice on politely telling your parents to mind their own business, what to do in London, confronting your daughter, and more!

episodes.title: Episode 106: Robin Lord Taylor
episodes.summary: The hot and hip Robin Lord Taylor joins Ronna & Beverly to talk about reading through Batman comics to get a better sense of the Penguin (which he portrays on Gotham), playing skateboard bros in commercials early on in his career, being roommates with Billy Eichner, Alan Cumming’s “Club Cumming,” and more. Plus, the ladies finally catch up on all of their shout outs!

episodes.title: Episode 105: Paget Brewster
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly are coming to you from the Earwolf studios with the lovely Paget Brewster chat about Brewster’s Millions, her great great grandfather being a co-founder of Goodrich, going to Australia with The Thrilling Adventure Hour, Tommy Lee Jones being nice to her, and more. Plus, Ronna & Beverly express their love to their wonderful fans as they unbox some delicious treats!

episodes.title: Episode 104: Eugene Cordero
episodes.summary: The incredibly hilarious Eugene Cordero joins Ronna & Beverly to talk about his hot new show Other Space on Yahoo Screen, the story behind his nick name Matty Boy, his love of CrossFit & the Rock, and the secret to having a great relationship. Plus, Beverly tells us what happened on her recent trip to LA to be a character witness for Robert Durst.

episodes.title: Episode 103: Listener Mail
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly respond to listener messages regarding Beverly reconnecting with her brother, Jordan’s dating life, accents, and much more as they go through their mail.

episodes.title: Episode 102: Drew Droege
episodes.summary: The very hilarious Drew Droege joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about growing up wanting to be a serious actor, how Melissa McCarthy inspired him to join the Groundlings, why the candy industry is ruining candy, the coined term lesbian bed death, and being the drunkest he’s ever been on his Drunk History appearance. Plus, the ladies remind everyone of the Purim story.

episodes.title: Episode 101: Tavi Gevinson
episodes.summary: The voice of our generation, Tavi Gevinson joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about creating the very popular fashion blog Style Rookie at the age of twelve, who looked good at the Oscars, her experience doing the play “This Is Our Youth” alongside Michael Cera, and her thoughts on unplugging from the internet. Plus, Ronna & Beverly speak on their dearly departed friend Harris Wittels.

episodes.title: Episode 100: OSCAR Predictions
episodes.summary: It's the 100th episode of Ronna & Beverly!!! What better way to celebrate than to have Oscar experts Adam B. Vary & Kate Aurthur of BuzzFeed return for a special Oscar predictions show! From Boyhood to the Birdman to Whiplash, who will win for best picture? Which actors and actresses will take away the gold for their performance? Tune in to hear from the best!

episodes.title: Episode 99: Lindsey Stoddart and Leslie Bibb
episodes.summary: The wonderful ladies of the new Amazon show Salem Rogers: Model of the Year 1998, Lindsey Stoddart and Leslie Bibb join Ronna & Beverly to chat about the story, the characters, and the actors in the show, the shame they get watching terrible reality shows, a 16-year-old Leslie being crowned the winner of Oprah's first nationwide model search, babies, and their significant other. Plus, Ronna explains how she was superstitious about the Super Bowl and Beverly gives us the recap on the important moments of the Kitten Bowl.

episodes.title: Episode 98: Gabrielle Union and Regina Hall
episodes.summary: Two of the most gorgeous women in the world, Gabrielle Union and Regina Hall join Ronna & Beverly to chat about their new Lifetime movie “With This Ring,” Gabrielle’s wedding in a castle in Miami, Regina running into Gabrielle in her first audition in LA, what they were wearing at the Golden Globes, Regina being a foot model for Sam & Libby shoes, and their wonderful dogs. Plus, Ronna & Beverly talk about going to Alcatraz with the possibly closeted John Ross Bowie.

episodes.title: Episode 97: Christopher Noxon
episodes.summary: Esteemed author Christopher Noxon joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about scissoring possibly being a myth, feeling like adults have taken Halloween away from kids, why adults act more like kids now, his new Plus One: A Novel, and the similarities the characters in the book have with his wife Jenji Kohan & himself. Plus, the ladies tell us who looked good and who didn’t at the Golden Globes.

episodes.title: Episode 96: Nate Corddry
episodes.summary: Happy New Year! Boston's own Nate Corddry joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about his podcast Reading Aloud making number 1 on iTunes, touring through Boston with a stage production of The Graduate, working with Bill Murray on St. Vincent, and naming his cat after Wally the Green Monster. Plus, Ronna helps Beverly piece together what happened on New Years.

episodes.title: Episode 95: Live with Jack Black and Paul F. Tompkins
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly had a wonderful time at the new UCB-Sunset in Los Angeles and they are now sharing their great time with you! Jack Black and Paul F. Tompkins are your wrapped up Hanukkah and Christmas presents this year. Happy Holidays and Happy New Year to all!This episode is sponsored by:  Squarespace . Use the offer code GINSBERG at checkout for 10% off.Club W. Go to  clubw.com/shalom  to get a bottle of wine on the house with your first order!

episodes.title: Episode 94: Advice
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly are here to offer advice on age secrets, dating a possible alcoholic, finding a Jewish woman as a non Jewish man, and much more. Sit tight and let these ladies make your life better with their wisdom!

episodes.title: Episode 93: Joe Lo Truglio
episodes.summary: The lovable and hilarious Joe Lo Truglio of Brooklyn Nine-Nine joins Ronna & Beverly to tell us all about what it’s like working with his many amazing co-stars. They also chat about Joe being a newlywed, dreaming of Terry Crews, a brand new digital series that Joe stars in and co-created called BEEF, what Christopher Meloni is really like, and tush play. Plus, the ladies talk about their obsession with the Serial podcast and their Thanksgiving plans.

episodes.title: Episode 92: Matt Besser
episodes.summary: The always sharp Matt Besser of improv4humans joins Ronna & Beverly to tackle his issues with disgusting eaters. They also chat about the use of improv in many TV shows today, Monica Lewinsky being back in the news, duck penises, his upcoming Adult Swim infomercial parody “In Search of Miracle Man” with Rich Fulcher, and the brand new UCB-Sunset theatre. Plus, Beverly tells us about her recent sugar fueled rampage on Halloween.

episodes.title: Episode 91.5: Bob Odenkirk
episodes.summary: Happy Halloweenie!!! The ghost of Bob Odenkirk is here for a bonus episode of Ronna & Beverly to chat about his brand new book A Load of Hooey, how he calls up David Cross everyday to check in on who is getting ahead in the biz, how he got involved with Breaking Bad, Antiques Roadshow, and the upcoming Better Call Saul series.

episodes.title: Episode 91: Sean Sakimae
episodes.summary: Adorable podcast enthusiast Sean Sakimae joins Ronna & Beverly for a special episode made possible through Kulap Vilaysack’s Origin Story documentary Indiegogo campaign! They chat about Sean’s nerdy days in high school, how he charmed his way from food service into sales, owning a ghost of a dog, being closer to his brother through podcasts, and where he sees himself in the next 10 years. Plus, the ladies talk Halloween as they explain the problem with Milky Way bars these days.

episodes.title: Episode 90: Jenji Kohan
episodes.summary: The wonderful Jenji Kohan, creator of Orange Is The New Black joins Ronna & Beverly to answer all of their OITNB questions. They also chat about scuba diving, Jenji’s hairdresser L'Nor & her creativity, the Emmys, Naked and Afraid, and Jenji’s upcoming project about the Salem Witch Trials for HBO. Plus, Beverly explains why she wants to renounce her motherhood.

episodes.title: Episode 89: Jerry O'Connell
episodes.summary: The absolutely wonderful Jerry O'Connell joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about Uber safety, constantly being mistaken for Jason Bateman, taking UCB classes through a recommendation from Jerry Minor, his rule regarding See’s Candies in his home, and his incredible fencing skills. Plus, the ladies share their plans for Yom Kippur break-fast.

episodes.title: Episode 88: Sarah Burns
episodes.summary: The incredibly talented actress/comedian Sarah Burns joins Ronna & Beverly for a fascinating chat all about her life. They’ll talk about everything from her training at The Lee Strasberg Theatre & Film Institute, performing at both UCB NY & LA, her experience as a regular on HBO’s Enlightened, and her tremendous love of both her husband & cooking. Plus, Ronna shares a story about the time she met Joan Rivers as the ladies take some time to remember her.

episodes.title: Episode 87: Totally Laime
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly are joined by the first ever married couple they've had on the podcast, Elizabeth Laime and Andy Rosen aka Psychic Andy. They chat about the meaning of P.I.V., how Elizabeth & Andy met, butt thumbing, Elizabeth's experience having a water birth, and the secret to a having a good marriage. Also, Ronna may or may not have attended the Cheryl Hines & Robert F. Kennedy Jr. wedding and she may or may not tell us all about it.

episodes.title: Episode 86: Eliot Glazer
episodes.summary: Comedian extraordinaire and writer for TV Land’s Younger, Eliot Glazer joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about the times when his sister Ilana & his NY accent comes out, why hot yoga is his life, the significance of his Bea Arthur tattoo, how a relationship he was in ended extremely abruptly, and he sings a little opera for us. Plus, the ladies reminisce about the great & kind Robin Williams.

episodes.title: Episode 85: Richard Lawson
episodes.summary: Vanity Fair.com critic/columnist Richard Lawson joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about the time he came out to his mother, reporting on The Vanity Fair Cannes Festival Party at the Hôtel du Cap, why he no longer watches The Real Housewives shows, and what summer movies he is looking forward to covering. Plus, Beverly explains why she is in a stress machine this summer.

episodes.title: Episode 84: Danielle Schneider and Dannah Phirman
episodes.summary: Creators and writers of the show The Hotwives of Orlando, Danielle Schneider and Dannah Phirman, talk about their new show on Hulu, what it's like being in a writer's room, and how to get a man to marry you. Plus, the ladies discuss what causes allergies, reminisce on their grandparents, and dole out a few juicy easter eggs for the next time you watch The Hotwives of Orlando. Will Ronna and Beverly spend their afterlives together? Find out for yourselves in this week's episode.

episodes.title: Episode 83: Howard Kremer
episodes.summary: Celebrate July 4th with Ronna, Beverly, and Who Charted’s own Howard Kremer! They'll chat about Howard’s career before Who Charted, the origin of the name Kremer, who gets inside his heart, and who the woman version of Howard would be. Plus, the ladies discuss their plans for 4th of July. This episode is sponsored by: Cards Against Humanity  Care.com: Go to  www.care.com/ronna  and save 25% when you become a Premium Member.

episodes.title: Episode 82: Humphrey Ker
episodes.summary: Delightful British actor/writer/comedian Humphrey Ker joins Ronna & Beverly to chat about how he has been told he has a period face, where his family falls in the class system, his show “Dymock Watson: Nazi Smasher,” his thoughts on the new Muppet movie, and the time he met Vladimir Putin. Plus, Beverly is excited to tell us all how her daughter has finally caught a fish.  This episode is sponsored by:  Squarespace . Use the offer code GINSBERG for a free trial and 10% off. Care.com: Go to  www.care.com/ronna  and save 25% when you become a Premium Member.

episodes.title: Episode 81: David Huntsberger
episodes.summary: Straight man/comedian/podcaster David Huntsberger joins Ronna & Beverly inside the Earwolf studios to chat about how he went from being a substitute teacher to a career in stand-up comedy, being a pretty normal person, making shoes, and why he thinks the act of proposing is unoriginal. Plus, everyone learns about each other as they play a word association game.  This episode is sponsored by  Squarespace . Use the offer code GINSBERG for a free trial and 10% off.

episodes.title: Episode 80: Dana Goodman and Julia Wolov
episodes.summary: The very pretty comedy duo, Dana Goodman and Julia Wolov, join Ronna & Beverly to chat about their very serious new cartoon "Biatches", working with Adam Sandler, and the fact that everyone in Los Angeles wants to have sex with them.  Plus a rift is formed in Ronna & Beverly's friendship.This episode is sponsored by  Squarespace . Use the offer code GINSBERG for a free trial and 10% off.

episodes.title: Episode 79: Advice
episodes.summary: Wait no longer because Ronna & Beverly bring you the long awaited advice show! Join them as they answer your questions regarding dogs, wedding gifts, online dating, and much more. Let these gals change your life with their combined wisdom! This episode is sponsored by:  Squarespace . Use the offer code GINSBERG for a free trial and 10% off. Audible. For a free audio book and free 30 day trial go to  www.audiblepodcast.com/randb

episodes.title: Episode 78: Janet Varney
episodes.summary: Fabulous actress/comedian/podcaster Janet Varney joins Ronna & Beverly inside the Earwolf studios to chat about starting the SF Sketchfest Festival with her comedy sketch group, her podcast The JV Club that exclusively features only female guests, being recently cast in a tennis centric pilot, and what really infuriates her. Plus, the girls give us all the details on their new ringtone now available for sale in the  Earwolf store .  This episode is sponsored by  Squarespace . Use the offer code GINSBERG for a free trial and 10% off.

episodes.title: Episode 77: Jason Nash
episodes.summary: Vine expert and Sklarbro Country regular Jason Nash joins Ronna & Beverly this week from the Earwolf studios to talk about wanting to be a sportscaster at a young age, looking like a lesbian, being called "chubs" as a kid, the rules of Snapchat, and his upcoming Comedy Central movie "Jason Nash Is Married." Plus, the girls tells us about their upcoming Passover plans and Beverly remembers Michael Jackson.  This episode is sponsored by  Squarespace . Use the offer code GINSBERG for a free trial and 10% off.

episodes.title: Episode 76: Stephen Tobolowsky
episodes.summary: The tremendously talented actor/writer Stephen Tobolowsky joins Ronna & Beverly this week in Los Angeles from the Earwolf studios to chat about the story behind his last name, his journey towards getting into Judaism again, and what his audition process for Groundhog Day was like. Plus, Beverly tells us about the magic fat burning diet she found.  This episode is sponsored by  Squarespace . Use the offer code BESTSELLER for a free trial and 10% off.

episodes.title: Episode 75: Arden Myrin
episodes.summary: The terrific and adorable Arden Myrin joins Ronna and Beverly to chat about how her father eats cookies with a hammer, her older brother who is blind in one eye, the time she got injured while doing the worm onstage, and why MADtv is the reason she remains a blonde. Plus, Beverly shares her love of Frozen. This episode is sponsored by  Squarespace . Use the offer code BESTSELLER for a free trial and 10% off.

episodes.title: Episode 74: The Oscar Special w/ Jace Lacob, Kate Aurthur, Adam B. Vary
episodes.summary: Oscar season is upon us so Ronna and Beverly are coming to you from Hollywood for a special Oscar episode with experts Jace Lacob, Kate Aurthur, and Adam B. Vary of BuzzFeed! Who will win Best Actor in a Leading Role? Who will win Best Actress in a Leading Role? What will win Best Picture? They’ll use the expertise to give us their Oscar predictions and more!

episodes.title: Episode 73: Live at the San Francisco Sketch Fest
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly had a terrific time at this year's San Francisco Sketch Fest and are now sharing it with you! With the company of baby faced Michael Ian Black & trusty trainer Bob Harper what more can you ask for? Maybe a little recap of Ronna & Beverly’s San Fran adventures would serve as the cherry on top of this delectable show!

episodes.title: Episode 072: Live At Riot L.A.
episodes.summary: The childlike Paul Scheer talks about becoming a father very soon, being tricked by his god daughter, and his brief brush with the law in Arizona on today's Ronna & Beverly recorded LIVE at the RIOT LA festival! Plus, we hear about Ronna & Beverly's personal Jewish Hollywood tour.

episodes.title: Episode 071: Bob Harper
episodes.summary: Personal trainer/author Bob Harper is back to chat with Ronna & Beverly and this time they’re in the Earwolf studios! Bob explains how he got featured as a trainer on The Biggest Loser, shares what his favorite southern phrases are, and gives us a recipe for bullet proof coffee. He also tells us which celebrity he trained was the most out there while answering your Twitter questions!

episodes.title: Episode 70: LIVE w/ Jacki Weaver and Patrick J. Adams
episodes.summary: Start off the new year right with Ronna & Beverly! They bring you a terrific LIVE episode from the UCB theater in Los Angeles with Academy Award nominated actress Jacki Weaver and delightful actor Patrick J. Adams of USA Network's Suits. People of San Francisco, you can see Ronna & Beverly LIVE as part of the SF Sketchfest on January 30th at The Eureka Theatre at 8pm! Go to  www.sfsketchfest.com  for tickets.

episodes.title: Episode 069: Live from the UCB Theater
episodes.summary: Tis' the season to spend with Ronna & Beverly! They’ll share their Christmas plans and answer your wonderful questions before giving the gift of a LIVE episode from the UCB theater in Los Angeles with special guests Nia Vardalos (My Big Fat Greek Wedding) and Bob Harper (The Biggest Loser). Merry Christmas and Happy Sweet New Year everyone!

episodes.title: Episode 68: Leslie Grossman
episodes.summary: The fabulous Leslie Grossman drops by to chat about being adopted as a child, adopting her own child, her rare uterus condition, and her love of candy. Plus, Ronna and Beverly recall their Thanksgivingkkah.

episodes.title: Episode 67: Happy Thanksgivingkkah
episodes.summary: In honor of Thanksgivingkkah, Ronna and Beverly give a special gift to listeners by finally answering YOUR questions. They’ll offer some relationship advice, give us an update on Jordan, let everyone know about upcoming live shows, and more! You’re welcome!

episodes.title: Episode 66: Andy Daly
episodes.summary: TV’s Andy Daly visits Ronna & Beverly and it’s an absolute delight! They chat about Yogi Bear, why Andy gets cast as the jerk all the time, his upcoming TV show “Review with Forrest MacNeil,” his humble beginnings at Ithaca College, and how everyone makes mistakes. Plus, Beverly explains how she dealt with a biting pre-schooler.

episodes.title: Episode 65: Kate Walsh
episodes.summary: The charming Kate Walsh joins Ronna and Beverly to chat about Operation Smile, why all her friends wanted to beat her up as a kid, her perfume "Boyfriend," and her 3 upcoming movie roles. Also, Ronna & Beverly share their spoOoOoky Halloween plans!

episodes.title: Episode 64: Live From London
episodes.summary: Excuse me! Ronna & Beverly are coming to you from overseas for a special episode from the wonderful London with special guests Morwenna Banks and Mayor of Camden Jonathan Simpson! You’ll be some kind of schmuck if you don’t listen!

episodes.title: Episode 63: Adam Ray
episodes.summary: Comedian Adam Ray, along with his happy eyebrows and gruffness joins Ronna & Beverly for a wonderful chat about his time in Boston while shooting The Heat, Hootie & the Blowfish, being in choir as a kid, his old Universal Studios job portraying Wolverine, and sandwich shops. Plus, Beverly explains why YouTube made her miss the Emmys.

episodes.title: Episode 62: Lisa Lillien
episodes.summary: Hungry Girl Lisa Lillien joins Ronna and Beverly for a chat about rescue bunnies, what a porn house is, living by the 80-20 rule, sushi, how she got started with Hungry Girl, and how the magic shell ice cream topping works. Also, Ronna & Beverly take us through their Yom Kippur routine.

episodes.title: Episode 61: Judy Reyes
episodes.summary: The incredibly talented and wonderful Judy Reyes visits Ronna & Beverly to chat about the story behind her name, being recognized from Scrubs, what it’s like behind the scenes on Devious Maids, gay marriage, family, and if she’s ever been in a fight. Plus, Beverly explains the reasons for making a big change regarding temple.

episodes.title: Episode 60: LIVE w/ Ben Schwartz & Mark Feuerstein
episodes.summary: Once again it’s time for a special Ronna and Beverly episode recorded Live at the Upright Citizens Brigade in Los Angeles! The elegant Ben Schwartz stops by to give Ronna & Beverly a quiz on who was cast in his first pilot, tell us about being in the film Coffee Town, and to make up a new sexual term. Then talented actor Mark Feuerstein makes an appearance to talk about the time his bike was stolen, “The Preppie Killer,” and sometimes rapping on Royal Pains.

episodes.title: Episode 59: Live From Montreal
episodes.summary: Today’s special episode of Ronna and Beverly was recorded LIVE from Montreal with wonderful guests Nick Kroll and Andy Kindler! They discuss everything from allergies to Andy’s recent State of the Industry Address. You’ll be some kind of schmuck to miss it!

episodes.title: Episode 58: Steve Agee
episodes.summary: He’s taller than you think he is, Steve Agee joined Ronna & Beverly for a livestreamed episode to discuss the film Dealin’ With Idiots with Jeff Garlin, what’s the ideal date for Steve, and to go through Buzzfeed’s  51 Hottest Jewish Men In Hollywood  list. They also find out about Beverly’s questionable babysitting technique.

episodes.title: Episode 57: Alison Rosen
episodes.summary: Enjoy your Independence Day weekend with the ladies as they chat with the wonderful Alison Rosen! Alison tells us what lead to her getting engaged, auditioning to be apart of the Adam Carolla show, and how she’s going to re-invent television. It’s the perfect dessert to your BBQ!

episodes.title: Episode 56: Josh Fadem
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly are back from the UK to chat with the adorable & hilarious Josh Fadem! Josh talks about his tailor roots, his excitement for This Is The End, working on an upcoming horror comedy film, and hosting a comedy show out of one of the last remaining video stores that he works at. There’s also a ton of puns!

episodes.title: Episode 55: Sarah Baker
episodes.summary: The absolutely fabulous Sarah Baker visits Ronna & Beverly to talk about her wonderful experience working on Go On, her continuos string of older character names, her comedic role in upcoming Reese Witherspoon film The Good Lie, and The Groundlings’ Sunday Company. Plus, Ronna and Beverly recall their exciting Memorial Day weekend.

episodes.title: Episode 54: Kulap Vilaysack
episodes.summary: Spring has sprung as Who Charted’s Kulap Vilaysack joins Ronna & Beverly for a delightful chat that will surely make you giggle with glee! Kulap tells us about her parents, the original Ed Hardy, where the idea for Who Charted? came from, and what a typical day in her life is like. Plus, Beverly explains why she had to cancel her road trip to Nashville. People of London, come see Ronna & Beverly LIVE from the Soho Theatre on Thursday, June 13th & Friday, June 14th at 10pm. Go to  www.sohotheatre.com  for tickets.

episodes.title: Episode 53: Jim Rash
episodes.summary: Academy Award winner Jim Rash joins Ronna & Beverly for a wonderful chat! Jim tells us about getting mistaken for Moby & Steven Soderbergh, his upcoming coming of age film The Way, Way Back, and offers listeners some life advice. Also, important questions regarding apps, animal hunting, and Reese Witherspoon are answered!

episodes.title: Episode 51: Ted Griffin
episodes.summary: Accomplished screenwriter Ted Griffin visits Ronna & Beverly to tell us how he went from folding Gabriel Byrn’s underwear in a laundromat to selling his first script on today’s show! Ted also tells us about being buds with Martin Scorsese, his involvement in the upcoming film The Wolf of Wall Street, and a very interesting breakfast he had with Sir Anthony Hopkins. Plus, the ladies are worried about a cicada swarmadeggon. Come see Ronna & Beverly LIVE at the Upright Citizens Brigade theatre in Los Angeles Friday, April 19th with very special guests! Get tickets at  www.ucbtheatre.com

episodes.title: Episode 50: Kevin Pollak
episodes.summary: The fabulous Kevin Pollak joins Ronna & Beverly on their first livestreamed episode! They chat about when he will get married, having his  chat show  on Earwolf, and changing his name with his best friend growing up who was also named Kevin. Also, important questions regarding leather pants, impressions, and schmucks are answered!

episodes.title: Episode 49: Passover 2013
episodes.summary: Happy Passover everyone! Join Ronna & Beverly as they discuss an incident that happened on the first night of Passover. Beverly had a couple cups of wine and wants to apologize to Judy Perlow about something she said during Seder. Tune into a LIVE video podcast of Ronna & Beverly on Thursday, April 4th over at  Youtube.com/Earwolf !

episodes.title: Episode 48: Nate Corddry
episodes.summary: Ronna and Beverly welcome the absolutely adorable Nate Corddry to chat about comparisons with his brother Rob, where his darkness stems from, and how old he was when his mother decided to pursue an alternative lifestyle. Nate also explains how he used to give himself the “subway test,” shares a story about falling out of love, and describes his role in Chuck Lorre’s pilot “Mom.” Plus, Ronna and Beverly give their opinions on Jodi Arias.

episodes.title: Episode 47: Sam Pancake
episodes.summary: Ronna and Beverly are joined by entertainer extraordinaire Sam Pancake to help with their Oscar wrap-up! They talk about who looked the best, the terrible James Bond montage, and their thoughts on the winners. Also, Sam tells us about his time working on Friends, awful Civil war re-enactors, and co-writing the upcoming film Space Station 76.

episodes.title: Episode 46: Live at the San Francisco Sketch Fest
episodes.summary: Treat yourself to a special Ronna and Beverly episode recorded Live at the San Francisco Sketch Fest! Kasper Hauser’s James Reichmuth talks to us about doing community psychiatry, where the name for his comedy group Kasper Hauser came from, and what he would diagnose Beverly with. Singer/songwriter Jonathan Coulton also joins us to tell us about his exciting week involving Glee. Plus, the ladies share their experience visiting Alcatraz. Have a listen and enjoy this truly marvelous show!

episodes.title: Episode 45: Katie Dippold
episodes.summary: Katie Dippold introduces Ronna and Beverly to a new word association game! Katie visits Ronna & Beverly to talk about the process behind writing the upcoming comedy film The Heat, where Raiders of The Lost Ark took place, and how a concussion she received in 2nd grade could have possibly unlocked her creative side. Plus, Beverly lies to Ronna about getting her flu shot.

episodes.title: Episode 44: Gil Ozeri
episodes.summary: Ronna and Beverly are fascinated by the upbringing of our guest Gil Ozeri! Gil sits down to chat about his undetermined engagement plans, why he didn’t like Inglourious Basterds, and what he loves about visiting Israel. Also, Beverly is addicted to her iPhone and talks about an upcoming vacation to an unusual spot.

episodes.title: Episode 43: Rich Sommer
episodes.summary: Rich Sommer visits Ronna & Beverly to have a sophisticated conversation about everything important. They talk about his role on Mad Men, whether his character in The Devil Wears Prada was gay, and if he’s ever been hit on by anyone on the set of Mad Men. Plus, Beverly tells Ronna the truth about how she spent her New Year’s.

episodes.title: Episode 42: The Live Show
episodes.summary: Ronna and Beverly give us a holiday treat with the Live Hanukkah Special recorded LIVE at UCB-LA! Guests Paul F. Tompkins, Paget Brewster, and Angela Kinsey let us know what they do to celebrate the holidays, take a whack at the Hanukkah Pig Piñata, and have themselves a Secret Santa. Plus, Ronna and Bev explain why they are sick of Jews and talk about their Christmas plans. It’s an episode you won’t want to miss!

episodes.title: Episode 41: Jake Fogelnest
episodes.summary: Jewish baby Jake Fogelnest, of  The Fogelnest Files , visits Ronna & Beverly to talk about the dirty business of having a TV show as a kid, a driving test panic attack, and how much he enjoys Howard Stern. Plus, the gang discusses Ann Coulter's mental health.

episodes.title: Episode 40: Paul Gilmartin
episodes.summary: Paul Gilmartin of The Mental Illness Happy Hour Podcast stops by to get honest about his recurring dream about Ronna & Beverly. Paul talks about a typical day in his life, how his podcast has reached out to help others around the world, and why sometimes a podcast he recorded might not be released. Also, Ronna and Beverly tell us how their Thanksgiving went.

episodes.title: Episode 39: Shaun Sperling
episodes.summary: The presidential election took its toll on Beverly so Shaun Sperling stops by to cheer her up and discuss lighter topics. Shaun tells us the story behind his viral choreographed Bar Mitzvah video, talks about his love for Madonna, and how the video almost never made the light of day. Also, Ronna & Beverly recall Ronna’s election party and Beverly talks about her dental issues.

episodes.title: Episode 38: Tony Hale
episodes.summary: The great American actor Tony Hale stops by to share his love of cruises on today’s show! Tony talks about growing up in Florida, what his dream role would be, and gives us an update on the return of Arrested Development. Also, Beverly tells Ronna how she’s being haunted by her neighbor’s ghost.

episodes.title: Episode 37: Kevin Sussman
episodes.summary: The very talented Kevin Sussman has been in everything and now he’s a guest on today’s show! Kevin talks about being on set with Brad Pitt, explains how he got into acting, and describes how his time working at a comic book store was useful for his role on The Big Bang Theory. Plus, Ronna and Beverly discuss the presidential debate, Arnold Schwarzenegger’s appearance on 60 Minutes, and Danny Devito & Rhea Perlman’s breakup.

episodes.title: Episode 36: Brian Huskey
episodes.summary: Beverly uses her new psychic gift on our guest Brian Huskey! Brian sits down with Ronna and Beverly to talk about the origin of the name Huskey, how his daughter loves it when he pretends to get angry, and tells us about dressing up as a spaceman in Germany. Plus, Ronna confronts Beverly about chewing loudly during synagogue and eating Milky Ways on Yom Kippur.

episodes.title: Episode 35: June Diane Raphael
episodes.summary: We are overjoyed to be joined by the ray of sunshine that is June Diane Raphael! June gives us a little behind the scenes on the show NSTF:SD:SUV::, tells us how she once won a Latina America Award, and shares how she performed dental procedures on herself. Also, Ronna & Beverly get to the bottom of a past Summer romance.

episodes.title: Episode 34: Brandon Johnson
episodes.summary: The versatile Brandon Johnson joins Ronna and Beverly to talk about how his stand-up hustle lead him to open for Adam Sandler, his time as a Sous-chef for Jerry Bruckheimer, and being a carpenter in his spare time. Also, Beverly confesses about a recent connection she made on a cruise.

episodes.title: Episode 33: John Ross Bowie
episodes.summary: John Ross Bowie, a jack of all trades, drops by to talk about David Bowie’s eyes, playing an alpha-nerd, and his book on the movie Heathers. The ladies also explain the definition of a sex pest to Bowie and try to figure out a solution to a poison ivy outbreak possibly caused by a certain ice-cream scooper.

episodes.title: Episode 32: Steve Agee
episodes.summary: Steve Agee goes commando on his visit with Ronna & Beverly! They discuss how Steve   got sent to military school, why homeless people have Facebook pages, and if Steve’s ever got anyone pregnant. The girls also have trouble booking a gay cruise vacation. Enjoy!

episodes.title: Episode 31: Morgan Murphy
episodes.summary: Ronna and Beverly escape the world of paparazzi to interview comedian Morgan Murphy about her heritage, tattoos and single status. The ladies give Morgan some pointers to try and nab a man, but Beverly's babysitting helps Morgan decide against parenthood.

episodes.title: Episode 30: Matt Walsh
episodes.summary: Matt Walsh drops by to discuss kettle corn, kids, and the KKK. Plus the ladies get him to dish on all the inner workings of Walsh's HBO show Veep. Lie back in your relaxing cowboy tub, and enjoy!

episodes.title: Episode 29: Michael Strahan
episodes.summary: Former NFL star turned TV darling Michael Strahan talks ladies of the night, marriage, football, and Tom Brady's looks with Ronna and Beverly. Stay tuned to find out if he shows off his tush.

episodes.title: Episode 28: Scott Aukerman
episodes.summary: With all the stress going on in the personal lives of Ronna and Beverly, they need a good comedy show to relax and enjoy. Good thing Comedy Bang! Bang! on IFC premieres tonight! We have hostScott Aukerman here to tell us what we can expect and explain just why he insisted on a foreign wife. The sexual tension is palpable, so put down Fifty Shades of Grey and listen!

episodes.title: Episode 27: Connie Britton
episodes.summary: Do you love American Horror Story? Did you love Friday Night Lights? Of course you did! Connie Britton is sitting in with the ladies to talk about growing up with a genius father, being a twin, and cultivating a film career. God bless choices!

episodes.title: Episode 26: Tanlines
episodes.summary: Are you on Team Tanlines? These sweet Jewish boys are electronic musicians out of New York with great baby naming advice and even better day jobs (one of them, at least). You won't see them at Coachella, but you'll hear them this week on Ronna & Beverly! Our thoughts and prayers go out to Barbara Eschelbacher in her time of need.

episodes.title: Episode 25: Marc Maron
episodes.summary: We got the real WTF treatment this week. Ronna and Bev got to visit Marc Maron in the cat ranch and turn the tables on the popular podcast host. The ladies came just in the nick of time to help Marc out with his relationship woes.

episodes.title: Episode 24: Elizabeth Reaser
episodes.summary: There is so much going on in the lives of Ronna and Beverly. They have a new British television show and a complicated baby shower to prepare for, so it is shocking that they had time to sit down with the beautiful, vegetarian, possibly-lesbian actress Elizabeth Reaser. Elizabeth explains the allure of tofurkey and the rigorous coursework of theater school. Plus, she clears up some misconceptions about vampires and werewolves and everything else Twilight.

episodes.title: Passover Bonus Minisode
episodes.summary: There is a lot to do to prepare for Passover. The table needs to be set, the haggadah must be prepared, but if you have a little extra time before your family gets there, why not enjoy this bonus minisode of Ronna & Beverly? L'shanah haba'ah b'Yerushalayim!

episodes.title: Episode 23: Natasha Leggero
episodes.summary: What a cutie we have for you this week! Natasha Leggero is absolutely darling, and despite the fact that she insisted on discussing disgusting issues of sanitation with us, we still love her and would love to have her as a Facebook friend. Enjoy!

episodes.title: Episode 22: Broad City
episodes.summary: Are those wedding bells we hear? Nope, just the dulcet tones of Ronna and Beverly, back this week with Abbi Jacobson and Ilana Glazer of Broad City. These Groupon Gals talk grooming and dating while sharing their stories of New York City tragedy. Ronna and Bev have vital dating advice for all the young women listening, so this episode is not to be missed!

episodes.title: Episode 21: Joe McIntyre
episodes.summary: How did everyone enjoy The Academy Awards? Fresh from the hottest Oscar party in town, Ronna and Beverly are here with Joey McIntyre whose beautiful blue eyes enchant us as we learn about his travel style, dental hygiene, and tuchus. For those participating in a podcasting pool, you can place your bets on Joey being charming, funny, and an absolute delight!

episodes.title: Episode 20: Jeff Garlin
episodes.summary: Ronna and Beverly are vacationing in London, but they aren't taking any time off from their probing interviews. This week's subject is Jeff Garlin from Curb Your Enthusiasm who tells the ladies about his breakfast with Oprah, his pubic grooming conundrum, his most disliked celebrities, and his sexual desires towards one of our fair hosts. Which one? You'll have to listen to find out!

episodes.title: Episode 19: Heather Donahue
episodes.summary: Everyone, give a big round of applause to Ronna and Beverly who are joining us here on Earwolf! This week on the show, our favorite Jewish divorcees invite Heather Donahue from The Blair Witch Project to discuss the reinvigorating potential of a silent yoga retreat and marijuana farming.

episodes.title: Episode 18: David Sabino
episodes.summary: Beverly's booking streak continues with Marblehead's own David Sabino. The ladies record their first (& last) interview at Beverly's house.

episodes.title: Episode 17: Barbara Vinick
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly talk with Barbara Vinick, author of "Today I Am a Woman: Stories of Bat Mitzvah around the World", and ring in the new year six days after it arrived by revealing the resolutions they made...for each other.

episodes.title: Episode 16: Donna Kagan
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly talk to the North Shore's preeminent "peppy" party planner, Donna Kagan, about how to celebrate the holidays with an Elegant Touch.

episodes.title: Episode 15: Harris Wittels
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly teach Harris Wittels the meaning of life. Beverly has a new friend.

episodes.title: Episode 14: Rob Riggle
episodes.summary: Beverly suggests Rob Riggle create a line of womens underpants. Ronna & Bev recount this year's Thanksgiving.

episodes.title: Episode 13: Jimmy Pardo
episodes.summary: Beverly revisits her Halloween harassment by disgruntled neighborhood children. Ronna & Bev talk to Jimmy Pardo about opening for Conan, his own very successful podcast, and mistaking the sex of his baby.

episodes.title: Episode 12: Paget Brewster
episodes.summary: Paget Brewster gives the ladies a lesson in colonial history and the virtues of being with a younger man. And Ronna & Beverly help an ailing friend in two very different ways.

episodes.title: Episode 11: Martha Plimpton
episodes.summary: Martha Plimpton gives R & B a glimpse into the glamorous life of an Emmy nominee. Ronna & Beverly's relationship is tested by another revelation about Beverly and Ronna's brother.

episodes.title: Episode 10: Joel Stein
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly tell the tale of their Rosh Hashanah Brisket-Off and talk to Author/Journalist/Telegenic Jew Joel Stein about what it takes to be a man.

episodes.title: Episode 9: Ana Ortiz
episodes.summary: Ronna & Beverly talk to heavily pregnant "Ugly Betty" star Ana Ortiz, and a rift between the ladies still hasn't been healed.

episodes.title: Episode 8: Jon Daly
episodes.summary: Ronna suspects Beverly's summer cold is actually karaoke-induced laryngitis. The ladies talk to comedian Jon Daly about Ed Hardy, marijuana, and his upcoming podcast Sappity Tappity the Drunken Tree.

episodes.title: Episode 7: Andy Richter
episodes.summary: Andy Richter talks to Ronna & Bev about raising his children as nudists, his so-so movie career, and life with Conan. Beverly dances around Rachelle's affair with a professor and subsequent expulsion from ASU.

episodes.title: Episode 6: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen Kirkman lets the ladies in on the truth about her nipples, and her favorite Boston hot spots. Beverly has a serious problem with Ronna's neighbor.

episodes.title: Episode 5: Nick Kroll
episodes.summary: The ladies speak to Nick Kroll about love, his sizzing career, and playing Pharoah ... in SPANISH ... and Beverly generously offers to take Ronna's AmEx miles off her hands.

episodes.title: Episode 4: Paul Feig
episodes.summary: The ladies relive the tragic events of their July 4th, and talk to the always dapper and obscenely charming director of "Bridesmaids", Paul Feig.

episodes.title: Episode 3: Justin Kirk
episodes.summary: Beverly recounts a recent trip to Planned Parenthood, and the ladies talk to Weeds star Justin Kirk about promiscuity, whether or not all vampires are r****ts, and why he won't hire a midget.

episodes.title: Episode 2: Paul F. Tompkins
episodes.summary: Ronna & Bev cover such broad-ranging subjects as the post-Oprah landscape, switching the tags on a pair of underpants at Marshall's, and whether or not Paul F. Topmkins could play Hitler.

episodes.title: Episode 1: Julie Klausner
episodes.summary: The debut episode of The Ronna & Beverly Podcast.
